isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - REMOVE - REAR INTERIOR TRIM PANEL

svcsubproc.title: Remove Rear Interior Trim Panel on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models

note.para: The step below shows removing both driver and passenger side corner and side interior trim panels before removing rear interior trim panel. It is possible to remove the rear interior trim panel by removing one or the other of the side and corner interior trim panels then follow the steps below.

step1.para:
Remove passenger and driver side corner and side interior trim panel, refer to
CORNER AND SIDE INTERIOR TRIM PANEL
. For removing passenger and driver side corner and side interior trim panel from standard cab, refer to Remove corner and side interior trim panel on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models. For removing passenger and driver side corner and side interior trim panel from extended cab, refer to Remove corner and side interior trim panel on Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models. For removing passenger and driver side corner and side interior trim panel from crew cab, refer to Remove corner and side interior trim panel on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 107 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using push-in fastener removal tool (Item 1), remove five push-in fasteners (Item 2) across the top of the rear interior trim panel (Item 3). Lay them out of the way and save for installation.
Remove rear interior trim panel (Item 3) from the cab. Lay it out of the way and save for installation unless damaged and being replaced.
